answers.answer: pregnant? lack of iron have some tests done
This could be many things.  The only way to know for sure is to see your doctor.
Typical symptoms of pregnancy. Considered taking a test?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Commonest cause of chronic nausea is acidity. Take omeprazole (empty stomach in morning)and antacid gel and see if it helps. Liver and kidney dysfunction is another cause. Hence kidney and liver function tests should be done. Other causes are diabetes and hypothyroidism. Electrolyte imbalance too can cause nausea. IBS, gluten or lactose intolerance, parasites in gut too can be the cause. A stool test should be done for worms, giardiasis etc. Also if nothing is found then food challenge test to detect food intolerance should be done.Also the simplest could be that you are pregnant. So take a pregnancy test and see.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

Your symptoms are too vague.  More information is needed and a physical exam before ANY doctor can diagnose you.  You should not be taking any medications referred to you online until you know for sure what is wrong.  You need to see a real life doctor, in the flesh.
